revision_history.description: New data model format and notation; add IdentifyType

values.name: LightOutput
values.summary: Light output of a lighting product.

values.name: Display
values.summary: Presentation will be visible on display screen.

values.name: Actuator
values.summary: Presentation will be conveyed by actuator functionality such as through a window blind operation or in-wall relay.

values.name: Blink
values.summary: e.g., Light is turned on/off once.

values.name: Breathe
values.summary: e.g., Light is turned on/off over 1 second and repeated 15 times.

values.name: Okay
values.summary: e.g., Colored light turns green for 1 second; non-colored light flashes twice.

values.name: ChannelChange
values.summary: e.g., Colored light turns orange for 8 seconds; non-colored light switches to the maximum brightness for 0.5s and then minimum brightness for 7.5s.

values.name: FinishEffect
values.summary: Complete the current effect sequence before terminating. e.g., if in the middle of a breathe effect (as above), first complete the current 1s breathe effect and then terminate the effect.

values.name: StopEffect
values.summary: Terminate the effect as soon as possible.

values.name: Default
values.summary: Indicates the default effect is used

cluster_info.raw_text_preview:
--- Page 109 (Content Page 105) ---
The set of ModeTagStruct Value field values defined in each of the generic or derived Mode Base
cluster specifications is called ModeTag.
The following table defines the common ModeTag values.
Mode Tag Value
Name
0x0000
Auto
0x0001
Quick
0x0002
Quiet
0x0003
LowNoise
0x0004
LowEnergy
0x0005
Vacation
0x0006
Min
0x0007
Max
0x0008
Night
0x0009
Day
1.10.8.1. Auto Tag
The device decides which options, features and setting values to use.
1.10.8.2. Quick Tag
The mode of the device is optimizing for faster completion.
1.10.8.3. Quiet Tag
The device is silent or barely audible while in this mode.
1.10.8.4. LowNoise Tag
Either the mode is inherently low noise or the device optimizes for that.
1.10.8.5. LowEnergy Tag
The device is optimizing for lower energy usage in this mode. Sometimes called "Eco mode".
1.10.8.6. Vacation Tag
A mode suitable for use during vacations or other extended absences.
1.10.8.7. Min Tag
The mode uses the lowest available setting value

revision_history.description: Behavior clarifications for ambiguous combinations of events; Introduction of TotalNumberOfPressesCounted == 0 when MultiPressMax is exceeded; Introduction of ActionSwitch feature flag.

attributes.name: MinMeasuredValue
attributes.constraint: A value of null indicates that this attribute is not defined.

attributes.name: MaxMeasuredValue
attributes.constraint: A value of null indicates that this attribute is not defined.

attributes.name: LightSensorType
attributes.constraint: This attribute SHALL be set to one of the non-reserved values listed in LightSensorTypeEnum or null in case the sensor type is unknown.

attributes.name: MeasuredValue
attributes.constraint: where 1 lx <= illuminance <= 3.576 Mlx, corresponding to a MeasuredValue in the range 1 to 0xFFFE. • 0 indicates a value of illuminance that is too low to be measured, • MinMeasuredValue <= MeasuredValue <= MaxMeasuredValue under normal circumstances, • null indicates that the illuminance measurement is invalid.

Added clarifications to Scenes support for Matter

Added Q quality for CurrentHue, CurrentSaturation, CurrentX, CurrentY, ColorTemperatureMireds, EnhancedCurrentHue and RemainingTime attributes. Added clarifications for behavior related to Step values. Added constraints on minimum acceptable color temperature values in mireds.

revision_history.description: New data model format and notation
New data model format and notation, added additional events
Mandatory global ClusterRevision attribute added; fixed some defaults; CCB 1823, 1480
New data model format and notation, added FeatureMap, collapsed attribute sets, clarified edge cases around limits, default value of xxxSetpointLimit now respects AbsxxxSetpointLimit
Introduced the LTNE feature and adapted text (spec issue #5778)
Update constraints on local temperature calibration and minimum setpoint deadband and introduced Presets and MatterScheduleConfiguration features
Added comment regarding writing to ControlSequenceOfOperation.

values.name: DoorOpen
values.summary: The cabinet’s door has been open for a vendor defined amount of time.

attributes.name: DoorOpen
attributes.constraint: If the generation of the alarm has not been suppressed at the device itself, then this attribute SHALL have these fixed values. If the generation of the alarm is suppressed at the device itself, then bit 0 SHALL have a value of 0. It SHALL be re-set to 1 if the alarm is re-enabled at the device itself.

values.name: Low
values.summary: Provides a low dryness level for the selected mode

attributes.name: SelectedDrynessLevel
attributes.constraint: If an attempt is made to write this attribute with a value other than null or a value contained in SupportedDrynessLevels, a CONSTRAINT_ERROR response SHALL be sent as the response. If an attempt is made to write this attribute while the device is not in a state that supports modifying the dryness level, an INVALID_IN_STATE error SHALL be sent as the response. A value of null SHALL indicate that there will be no dryness level setting for the current mode.

attributes.constraint: For this derived cluster, only these pre-defined strings may be used in the PhaseList attribute: "pre-heating", "pre-heated", and "cooling down". Other values SHALL NOT be used.

values.name: NoOptimization
values.summary: The device prohibits optimization of energy usage management: its energy usage is determined only by the user configuration and internal device needs.

values.name: DeviceOptimization
values.summary: The device is permitted to manage its own energy usage. For example, using tariff information it may obtain.

values.name: LocalOptimization
values.summary: The device permits management of energy usage by an energy manager to optimize the local energy usage.

values.name: GridOptimization
values.summary: The device permits management of energy usage by an energy manager to optimize the grid energy usage.
